        translator - The Translator to be used
        Returns:

      • translate

        public static String[] translate(String[] strings,
                 Translator translator,
                 boolean overwrite,
                 Object... options)
        Translate all strings in the specified string array using the specified Translator.
        Parameters:
        strings - The array of Strings to convert
        translator - The Translator used to manipulate or replace the Strings
        overwrite - Whether to overwrite the values in the input array, or create a new array
        options - Optional extra arguments, passed on to Translator.execute(String, Object...).
        Returns:
        The original array with the translated Strings

        converter - The Converter to be used
        Returns:

               boolean overwrite,
               Object... options)

        Parameters:
        objects - The objects to be converted
        converter - The GenericConverter to be used
        overwrite - Whether to overwrite the values in the input array, or create a new array
        options - Extra arguments, passed on the Converter.execute(Object, Object...)
        Returns:
        The converted objects

                Converter<T,U> converter,
                Object... options)

        Parameters:
        objects - The objects to be converted
        converter - The Converter to be used
        options - Extra arguments, passed on to Converter.execute(Object, Object...).
        Returns:
        The converted objects

      • in

        @SafeVarargs
public static <T> boolean in(T obj,
                         T... objs)
        Whether or not the specified object is in the specified array. This method only compares object references (using the == operator) to determine the outcome.
        Parameters:
        obj - The object
        objs - The array
        Returns:
        Whether or not the array contains a reference to the object
        See Also:
        has(Object, Object...)

      • has

        @SafeVarargs
public static <T> boolean has(T obj,
                          T... objs)
        Whether or not the specified object is in the specified array. This method does use the equals() method to test for the presence of the object.
        Parameters:
        obj - The object
        objs - The array
        Returns:
        Whether or not the specified object is in the specified array.
        See Also:
        in(Object, Object...)

      • implode

        public static String implode(Object[] objects)
        Implodes the specified array using a comma separator. The array elements are stringified using their toString() method.
        Parameters:
        objects - The array to implode
        Returns:
        The imploded array

      • implode

        public static String implode(Object[] objects,
             String separator)
        Implodes the specified array using the specified separator. The array elements are stringified using their toString() method.
        Parameters:
        objects - The array to implode
        separator - The separator
        Returns:
        The imploded array

      • implode

        public static String implode(Object[] objects,
             Stringifier callback,
             Object... options)
        Implodes the specified array using the specified Stringifier and using a comma separator. If the array is null or empty, an empty String ( StringUtil#E) is returned.
        Parameters:
        objects - The array to implode
        callback - The Stringifier to be used for each of the array's elements.
        separator - The separator between the stringified elements
        options - Extra arguments, passed on to Converter.execute(Object, Object...)
        Returns:
        The imploded array

      • implode

        public static String implode(Object[] objects,
             String separator,
             Stringifier callback,
             Object... options)
        Implodes the specified array using the specified separator and Stringifier. If the array is null or empty, an empty String ( StringUtil#E) is returned.
        Parameters:
        objects - The array to implode
        callback - The Stringifier to be used for each of the array's elements.
        separator - The separator between the stringified elements
        options - Extra arguments, passed on to Converter.execute(Object, Object...)
        Returns:
        The imploded array
